intro: Alloplectus ambiguus, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles, and is characterized by its opposite leaves and stinging hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikes, and it produces small, dry fruits. Alloplectus ambiguus is often found in the eastern United States and parts of Canada.
